distributional 0.3.2

The Beta distribution

Source: R/dist_beta.R
dist_beta.Rd

dist_beta(shape1, shape2)

Arguments

shape1, shape2

The non-negative shape parameters of the Beta distribution.

See also

stats::Beta

Examples

dist <- dist_beta(shape1 = c(0.5, 5, 1, 2, 2), shape2 = c(0.5, 1, 3, 2, 5))

dist
#> <distribution[5]>
#> [1] Beta(0.5, 0.5) Beta(5, 1)     Beta(1, 3)     Beta(2, 2)     Beta(2, 5)    
mean(dist)
#> [1] 0.5000000 0.8333333 0.2500000 0.5000000 0.2857143
variance(dist)
#> [1] 0.12500000 0.01984127 0.03750000 0.05000000 0.02551020
skewness(dist)
#> [1]  0.000000 -5.916080  2.581989  0.000000  5.962848
kurtosis(dist)
#> [1] -1.5000000  1.2000000  0.0952381 -0.8571429 -0.1200000

generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] 0.9706526 0.8280600 0.0271151 0.1095839 0.7664458 0.4563183 0.6431344
#>  [8] 0.9558057 0.5323430 0.9811400
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 0.9456971 0.9866728 0.6721853 0.9040558 0.9443940 0.9420856 0.6031266
#>  [8] 0.9177168 0.8527327 0.9479663
#> 
#> [[3]]
#>  [1] 0.07491993 0.26086000 0.07837876 0.25708856 0.19992561 0.10337376
#>  [7] 0.71409219 0.37474680 0.13540763 0.19015626
#> 
#> [[4]]
#>  [1] 0.3283235 0.6490615 0.6522486 0.1558935 0.2440348 0.2071506 0.6704233
#>  [8] 0.1092641 0.3861680 0.6747995
#> 
#> [[5]]
#>  [1] 0.33981461 0.21780758 0.32810598 0.20936352 0.39753363 0.23826367
#>  [7] 0.05796478 0.35994283 0.56247085 0.41350776
#> 

density(dist, 2)
#> [1] 0 0 0 0 0
density(dist, 2, log = TRUE)
#> [1] -Inf -Inf -Inf -Inf -Inf

cdf(dist, 4)
#> [1] 1 1 1 1 1

quantile(dist, 0.7)
#> [1] 0.7938926 0.9311499 0.3305670 0.6367425 0.3603577
